docblock.description: A collection of Exception classes.
docblock.long-description:
PHP version 5.3

docblock.description: Exception thrown if a vertex doesn't exist.
Constructor to create the NoVertexException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments to be embedded into the Exception message.

docblock.description: Exception thrown if an edge between certain vertices doesn't exist.
Constructor to create the NoEdgeException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments to be embedded into the Exception message.

docblock.description: Exception thrown if an edge between two vertices exists.
Constructor to create the EdgeExistsException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments to be embedded into the Exception message.

docblock.description: Exception thrown if a vertex exists.
Constructor to create the VertexExistsException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments to be embedded into the Exception message.

docblock.description: Exception thrown if there is no path betwee two vertices.
Constructor to create the NoPathException.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The arguments to be embedded into the Exception message.

docblock.description: Exception thrown if the parameter passed has an invalid type.
Constructor to create the InvalidTypeException.
Exception thrown if a graph contains a negative cycle.
Constructor to create the NegativeCycleException.
The Generic PGraph Exception class.
docblock.long-description:
All valid Exceptions will extend this class.

docblock.description: The main Exception class that is intended for being the benchmark for all Exceptions.
PGraphException Constructor.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Values to be embedded into the messages.

docblock.description: Initialize the $_messages array if it hasn't been done so.
The main PGraph file.
docblock.long-description:
This is where all the functions used by the users are.

PHP version 5.3

docblock.description: The main PGraph class that is intended for user usage.

tag.name: var
tag.description: This graph is either directed or undirected.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The number of negative weight edges.

docblock.description: A constructor to create the PGraph.

tag.name: param
tag.description: TRUE if we want to the graph to be directed. FALSE if we want it to be undirected. (Default: TRUE)

docblock.description: Gives the number of vertices.
Gets the value of the currently pointed vertex.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The value that is in the currently pointed vertex.

docblock.description: The index of the current vertex element.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The index of the currently pointed vertex.

docblock.description: Move the pointer to the next vertex.
Move the pointer to an array of vertices to the beginning.
Check if the array pointer is pointing to a valid array slot.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the current pointer is pointing the valid slot. FALSE, otherwise.

docblock.description: Check if the vertex with a given index exists.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the vertex with a given index exists. FALSE, otherwise.

docblock.description: Get the value of the vertex.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The data value. NULL, if the there is no value basedon the given index.

docblock.description: Add the vertex to the vertext array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The data contained in the vertex.

docblock.description: Unset the array element.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the index of an element to unset.

docblock.description: Add an edge between two vertices (if it doesn't exist).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of the first vertex. If the graph is undirected, the edge GOES FROM this vertex.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of the second vertex. If the graph is directed, the edge GOES INTO this vertex.

docblock.description: Provided the given vertices and the edge between them exists, change the weight of the edge.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of a vertex from which the edge GOES FROM.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of a vertex to which the edge GOES TO.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new weight of the edge.

docblock.description: Change the value of the already existing vertex.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The new value that the vertex should contain.

docblock.description: Remove the edge (if exists).

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index from which the edge GOES FROM.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index to which the edge GOES TO.

docblock.description: Add a new vertex into the graph.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of the next vertex

tag.name: param
tag.description: The value that the vertex will contain.

docblock.description: Remove the vertex if it exists.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of the vertex we want to remove.

docblock.description: Get the value of the vertex.
Returns the weight of the edge.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The vertex connected via an edge.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The vertex connected via an edge.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The weight of the edge. FALSE if the edge doesn't exist.

docblock.description: Find the shortest path between two vertices.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The path between the source and the destination. FALSE if there is no path or there is a negative-weight cycle.

docblock.description: Perform a Depth First Search starting from the given vertex.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of the starting vertex.

docblock.description: Perform a Breadth First Search starting from the given vertex.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of the starting vertex.

docblock.description: Get all the neighboring vertices of the given vertex.

tag.name: return
tag.description: All the neighbors of the given vertex.

docblock.description: Check if the vertex with a given index exists.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the vertex exists. FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: Check if there is an edge between two vertices.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The vertex from which the edge GOES FROM.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The vertex to which the edge GOES TO.

tag.name: return
tag.description: TRUE if the edge exists. FALSE otherwise.

docblock.description: A helper function used to perform either Depth First Search or Breadth First Search.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The index of the starting vertex.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Considering the usage of this function, it'll be either a Stack or Queue, depending on whether it's a Depth First Search or Breadth First Search.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The list of vertices traversed. FALSE, if the vertex doesn't exist.

docblock.description: Add the value into the linked list.

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$list Considering the usage, this will either be a Stack or a Queue.

docblock.description: Remove an element from the Stack or Queue.

tag.name: param
tag.description: &$list Considering the usage, this will either be a Stack or a Queue.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The index of a vertex that we removed from the list. NULL, if the type of the list is not recognized.

docblock.description: If there are no negative weight edges, use Dijkstra's algorithm to find the shortest path between two vertices.
If there is at least one negative weight edge, this is used to find the shortest path between two vertices.

tag.name: return
tag.description: The path between two vertices. FALSE if there is no path or a negative cycle has been detected.

docblock.description: This is where we define the graph vertex file.
docblock.long-description:
ALL CLASSES AND FUNCTIONS WRITTEN ARE HERE ARE NOT TO BE INSTANTIATED BY THE USER.

PHP version 5.3

docblock.description: The main PGraph class that is intended for user usage.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The data contained in the vertex.

tag.name: var
tag.description: The neighboring vertices of the current vertex.

tag.name: var
tag.description: Edge weights of the edges going to the associated neighbor.

docblock.description: The constructor used to create the PGraphVertex object.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the data that is to be held by this vertex.

docblock.description: Add an edge going into the given vertex.
Remove the edge connecting this vertex and the other vertex.

tag.name: param
tag.description: the index of the vertex to remove.

docblock.description: Get the weight of the neighbor.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the weight of the specified vertex index. FALSE if the vertex doesn't exist.

docblock.description: Return the data that is contained in this vertex.

tag.name: return
tag.description: the data contained in this vertex.

docblock.description: Get the list of neighboring vertices.
Get the edge weights array.
Set the weight of an edge connecting to the other vertex.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The vertex index to which this edge connects.

docblock.description: The extension of SplDoublyLinkedList used to simulate a queue used in Dijkstra's Algorithm.
docblock.long-description:
Even though the Fibonacci Heap would be the best choice for a queue, SPL didn't have one and implementation would've taken much longer.

PHP version 5

docblock.description: Extension of the SPLDoublyLinkedList class.
Removes the vertex with the smallest distance value and returns it.

tag.name: return
tag.description: Index of the vertex with the smallest distance value. NULL if the distances array is empty.
